text: Another question, is it possible to set example blocks to hard failure? We would like it if PRs failed if the docs have a regression, and nobody looks at the warnings in the log output

elements.text: Another question, is it possible to set example blocks to hard failure? We would like it if PRs failed if the docs have a regression, and nobody looks at the warnings in the log output

text:
I think an informal way of doing this would be to put an `@assert` somewhere that’s hidden. True errors will halt `makedocs` and cause CI to fail.

Below is untested but what I was thinking of-
```"""@example
a = 17
b = 18.0
# implicit type promotion
c = a + b
@assert c ≈ 35 # hide
"""```
